greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of identity bracelets of n beads of 4 colors.
comment: For n>2 also number of asymmetric bracelets with n beads of four colors. - _Herbert Kociemba_, Nov 29 2016
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
F. Ruskey, Necklaces, Lyndon words, De Bruijn sequences, etc.
F. Ruskey, Necklaces, Lyndon words, De Bruijn sequences, etc. [Cached copy, with permission, pdf format only]
Index entries for sequences related to bracelets
formula: More generally, gf(k) is the g.f. for the number of asymmetric bracelets with n beads of k colors.
mathematica: m = 4; (* asymmetric bracelets of n beads of m colors *) Table[Sum[MoebiusMu[d] (m^(n/d)/n - If[OddQ[n/d], m^((n/d + 1)/2), ((m + 1) m^(n/(2 d))/2)]), {d, Divisors[n]}]/2, {n, 3, 20}] (* _Robert A. Russell_, Mar 18 2013 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={if(n<3, binomial(4, n), sumdiv(n, d, moebius(n/d)*(4^d/n - if(d%2, 4^((d+1)/2), 5*4^(d/2)/2)))/2)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 12 2019
xref: Column k=4 of A309528 for n >= 3.
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_
